diagnosis.final_diagnosis: disseminated Staphylococcus aureus infection with cardiac involvement (endocarditis and pericarditis)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the clinical presentations of hemoptysis, pleural effusion, cavitary lung lesions, positive blood cultures for Staphylococcus aureus, and echocardiographic findings of vegetations on heart valves, in the context of intravenous bath salts use.
